faq.title: FAQ
faq.subtitle: Frequently asked questions about Base64 and Hex conversion

what.question: What are Base64 and Hex encoding?
what.answer: Base64 is a 64-character based encoding method commonly used for data transmission. Hex (hexadecimal) is a 16-character based encoding method commonly used to represent binary data.

why.question: Why do we need Base64 and Hex conversion?
why.answer: Different application scenarios require different encoding formats. Base64 is suitable for text transmission, while Hex is suitable for debugging and analysis. Conversion tools help switch between different formats.

safe.question: Is the conversion process safe?
safe.answer: Yes, all conversions are performed locally in your browser without uploading to servers, ensuring data security.

limit.question: Are there file size limits?
limit.answer: There are no strict limits, but please pay attention to browser performance when processing large data.
